oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Panamanian ceramic vessel
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian vessel with a narrow, flairing annular base with a wide body and a restricted lip. Vessel was found with 52 decorated spindle whorls and a rim sherd from a seperate vessel.
Signs of carbon around opening of vessel. Shows signs of general wear.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
